Posted By: Chimzar (4/25/2009 7:43:07 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The Win Condition with this card comes easily with three cards in particular...
  
   
Mossbridge Troll (Creature) (Because of the ability to tap power 10 from your creatures to give him a +20,+20)
  
   
Mighty Emergence (Enchantment) (5 or greater come into play with two extra +1, +1, not counting doubles)
  
   
And
  
   
Retaliator Griffin (Creature) (If u have enough life, and keep getting attacked to your life, his constant +1,+1's you recieve keep upgrading the enchantment)
  
   
Just be careful, mono white celestal purge gets rid of this card with ease, as well as the Griffin, so keep your eyes open...
  
   
Other than that, great card
posts.html:

And

Retaliator Griffin (Creature) (If u have enough life, and keep getting attacked to your life, his constant +1,+1's you recieve keep upgrading the enchantment)

Just be careful, mono white celestal purge gets rid of this card with ease, as well as the Griffin, so keep your eyes open...

Other than that, great card

posts.post_content:
This card can be usefull since if you can scare you opponent enought is might force him to use a ring of oblivion or a maelstrom pulse on it. and it will force him to react
  
   
But other wise it would give you a bonus at around turn 6 at the earliest in a realistic scenario.
  
   
Let say you have a deck build around using Mayael as soon as possible.
  
   
Turn 1 : Forest + Bird of paradise
  
Turn 2 : Plain + Wooly Thoctar but if your opponent is smart he will terminte, path to exile, ring of oblivion, flame javelin, 2 shock... ect your woolly thoctar. And considering that wooly thoctar is a 5/4 on turn 2 they will probably kill him a away or an other.
  
Turn 3 : Mountain + Mayael's Aria
  
   
So yeah if your lucky then maybe you could benefit at turn 4. but let's be realistic you'll need to come out with a new creature because no player a ready to fight a wooly thoctar before turn 5 so they will path to exile or terminate him or block with a 1/1 then agony warp him... and if your opponent let yo... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: I play this in my Naya deck now with [Apocalypse Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Apocalypse Hydra) and [Mycoloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycoloth). Pretty awesome. It's not too hard to get the conditional win with [Apocalypse Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Apocalypse Hydra), especially if you are using any kind of mana acceleration. And the counters accelerate how many babies [Mycoloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycoloth) pumps out each turn and makes them beefier. I do agree with comments on how this card seems too uber, but I play with it anyway. :)
posts.html:
I play this in my Naya deck now with Apocalypse Hydra and Mycoloth. Pretty awesome. It's not too hard to get the conditional win with Apocalypse Hydra, especially if you are using any kind of mana acceleration. And the counters accelerate how many babies Mycoloth pumps out each turn and makes them beefier. I do agree with comments on how this card seems too uber, but I play with it anyway. :)

posts.post_content:
As long as you can manage the mana base (easy enough with all the new double/triple lands) this card is extremely broken with [Wall of Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Blood).  
  
All you need is some green/white life gain cards in your hand, instant life gain (putting you over 20) on your untap step, ramp your wall up over 20 power, and instant good game.
